DOC.brief_summary: The study randomize , single-blinded , control intervention trial compare effect low glycemic index diet versus diet recommend Chinese Dietary Guide Pregnant Women maternal neonatal insulin resistance adverse gestational event .
DOC.brief_title: Low Glycemic Index ( GI ) Diet Management Pregnant Woman With Overweight
DOC.detailed_description: Overweight pregnant woman increase maternal insulin resistance risk adverse pregnancy outcome . Recent evidence animal study human subject study show adverse environmental exposure pregnancy result adverse influence offspring . The hypothesis current study healthy intervention pregnancy overweight pregnant woman -- low glycemic diet , may improve maternal neonatal insulin resistance birth . The current study adopts randomize , single-blinded , control intervention trial , give low glycemic index diet intervention base national diet physical activity recommendation pregnant woman intervention group national diet recommendation control group . Four diet consultation interview do , baseline ( first prenatal examination ) , end 1st trimester , 2nd trimester 3rd trimester respectively , include diet assessment diet consultation specifically adopt low glycemic diet . Glycemic load diet calculate base 24 hour diet recall data individual every visit help lower diet glycemic load modify daily food . The effect intervention investigate compare insulin resistance level two arm birth infant age 2 . For discrete trait , incidence gestational diabetes gestational hypertension , Person 's chi-square test use . For continuous trait , insulin resistance index , maternal weight gain neonatal birth weight , use t-tests comparison two group . The study expect long-term low GI diet intervention beneficial effect control maternal neonatal insulin resistance overweight woman long term health .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Singleton pregnancy ; Pregnant woman BMIâ‰¥24 kg/m2 first antenatal examination ; age 18 year 45 year ; The week first prenatal examination equal le 12 week ; Take routine prenatal examination ; Willing able give inform consent . Exclusion Artificial impregnation ; History hypertension , diabetes , coronary heart disease mental disorder ; With Special diet habit ( e.g . vegetarianism/ veganism ) .
